Wonky Sprout OS

FAMILY STRUCTURE MODE (FSM-SOP)

Active Period: Friday 4:00 PM ‚Üí Monday 6:00 PM

Purpose: Shared structure, low-stimulation environment, and high-vigilance parenting. Minimize ‚Äúunstructured chaos‚Äù for both you and your children while maintaining your own regulation.

Foundation: This mode builds on top of Foundational Daily Protocols (FDP-SOP). All 5 foundational protocols remain active.

üöÄ QUICK JUMP TO SECTION

üìÖ Friday Transition ‚òÄÔ∏è Saturday Schedule üè° Sunday at Grandma's üåÖ Monday Departure üçΩÔ∏è Meal Schedule ‚úÖ Daily Checklist üõ†Ô∏è Tools Required

FRIDAY TRANSITION (4:00 PM - 6:00 PM)

3:30 PM - 4:00 PM | Final Solo Prep (30 minutes)

  • Action:
    1. Complete all in-progress work (hard stop at 4:00 PM)
    2. Save all files, commit code to GitHub
    3. Close all deep work tools (VS Code, heavy apps)
    4. Mental transition: ‚ÄúSolo mode complete, Family mode loading‚Äù

4:00 PM - 5:00 PM | Environment Preparation (1 hour)

  • Protocol: Family Transition Setup
  • Action:
    1. Visual Schedule Creation (20 min):
      • Write weekend schedule on large whiteboard
      • Include: Meal times, activities, quiet times, projects
      • Make it visible in common area
      • Example: 
        SATURDAY
9:00 AM  - Breakfast
10:00 AM - Park / Outdoor Time
12:00 PM - Lunch
1:00 PM  - Quiet Time (Reading/LEGOs)
3:00 PM  - Woodworking Project
6:00 PM  - Dinner (Tacos)
    2. Command Center Shift (15 min):
      • Move work materials out of common space
      • Set up shared activity materials (LEGOs, books, project supplies)
      • Prepare Bubble Shield Profile 2.0 settings on headphones
    3. Meal Verification (10 min):
      • Confirm all weekend meals are prepped or planned
      • Verify ingredients for fixed meal schedule
    4. Mental Load (15 min):
      • Review any specific child needs for weekend
      • Set intention: ‚ÄúHigh vigilance, low stimulation, shared structure‚Äù

5:00 PM - 6:00 PM | Arrival & Orientation (1 hour)

  • Children Arrive: 5:00 PM (approximate)
  • Action:
    1. Greeting & Decompression (15 min):
      • Low-energy welcome (no overstimulation)
      • Allow settling in period
      • Put away bags/belongings
    2. Visual Schedule Review (10 min):
      • Walk children through whiteboard schedule
      • Answer questions about activities
      • Establish expectations (transparency reduces anxiety)
    3. Bubble Shield Profile 2.0 Active (remaining time):
      • Put on Soundcore Space One headphones
      • Transparency 5 / Volume 10%
      • Maintain during high-traffic periods (dinner prep, transitions)
    4. Light Activity (remaining time):
      • Unstructured play in designated area
      • Monitor from distance with headphones

SATURDAY SCHEDULE (FULL DAY)

6:00 AM - 7:00 AM | Personal Morning

  • FDP Active: Water Protocol ‚Üí Pill Protocol (3 minutes)
  • Personal Time (57 min):
    • Shower, get ready
    • Coffee, light breakfast
    • Mental prep for day
    • Review visual schedule
  • Note: Children likely still sleeping‚Äîuse this time for self-regulation

7:00 AM - 9:00 AM | Morning Buffer

  • Children Wake (gradual, varies by child)
  • Action:
    • Assist with wake-up as needed
    • Light breakfast available (self-serve if age-appropriate)
    • Low-stimulation morning (no screens, calm music/audiobooks OK)
  • Bubble Shield: Active during transitions (Profile 2.0)

9:00 AM - 10:00 AM | Breakfast & Morning Routine (1 hour)

  • Shared Breakfast (30 min):
    • Fixed menu (e.g., pancakes, eggs, oatmeal)
    • Predictable routine reduces decision fatigue
  • Morning Cleanup (15 min):
    • Children assist with dishes (age-appropriate)
    • Tidy common areas
    • Get dressed for day
  • Activity Prep (15 min):
    • Gather supplies for morning activity
    • Sunscreen, water bottles, appropriate clothing

10:00 AM - 12:00 PM | Structured Activity Block 1 (2 hours)

  • Protocol: Outdoor/Physical Activity
  • Options:
    • Park visit (playground, walking trails)
    • Backyard play (structured games, exploration)
    • Nature walk (low-intensity, sensory-friendly)
  • Purpose: Physical regulation, dopamine reset for all
  • Bubble Shield: OFF (full engagement, situational awareness without filter)
  • Note: High vigilance required‚Äîphysical safety monitoring

12:00 PM - 1:00 PM | Lunch & Transition (1 hour)

  • Fixed Lunch (30 min):
    • Predictable meal (e.g., sandwiches, fruit, simple sides)
    • Hydration emphasis (water, low-sugar drinks)
  • Post-Meal Wind Down (30 min):
    • Gentle transition to low-energy state
    • Light cleanup
    • Bathroom breaks
    • Mental prep for quiet time

1:00 PM - 3:00 PM | Quiet Time Protocol (2 hours)

  • Protocol: Sensory Regulation Block (CRITICAL)
  • Action:
    1. Designate separate low-stimulation activities:
      • Reading (books, comics, age-appropriate)
      • Drawing/coloring
      • LEGOs/building toys
      • Puzzles
    2. NO SCREENS (non-negotiable for regulation)
    3. Separated Spaces (if possible):
      • Each child in own quiet zone
      • Reduces sibling conflict, allows self-regulation
    4. Light Supervision:
      • Check-ins every 20-30 minutes
      • Intervene only if needed
  • Personal Time:
    • This is YOUR regulation time too
    • Read, light hobby work, rest
    • Bubble Shield Profile 2.0 can be active (maintain awareness)
  • Purpose: Resets executive function for both you and children

3:00 PM - 5:00 PM | Structured Interest Block (2 hours)

  • Protocol: Shared Hyper-Focus Activity
  • Options:
    • Woodworking project (building birdhouse, simple furniture)
    • 3D printing session (design + print small items)
    • Electronics project (simple circuits, LED projects)
    • Gardening (planting, maintenance, harvesting)
  • Purpose:
    • Shared intense interest = regulation + connection
    • Teaches skills, builds mastery
    • Low verbal demand, high parallel-play potential
  • Execution:
    • Set clear project goal (‚ÄúToday we finish the birdhouse roof‚Äù)
    • Assign age-appropriate tasks
    • Work alongside children (parallel focus)
  • Bubble Shield: OFF (full engagement)

5:00 PM - 6:00 PM | Dinner Prep & Transition (1 hour)

  • Dinner Prep (30 min):
    • Fixed Saturday meal (e.g., Tacos)
    • Children assist with simple tasks (setting table, toppings)
    • Predictable routine
  • Bubble Shield: Profile 2.0 ACTIVE (kitchen can be high-stimulation)
  • Wind Down (30 min):
    • Light activity while cooking
    • Hydration check
    • Cleanup prep

6:00 PM - 7:00 PM | Dinner & Cleanup (1 hour)

  • Shared Dinner (40 min):
    • Fixed meal, predictable
    • Low-pressure conversation
    • Hydration focus
  • Cleanup (20 min):
    • Children assist with dishes
    • Kitchen reset
    • Prepare for evening

7:00 PM - 8:30 PM | Evening Free Time (1.5 hours)

  • Low-Stimulation Options:
    • Board games (turn-based, low-conflict)
    • Reading aloud (audiobooks, shared stories)
    • Drawing/art
    • Light outdoor time (if weather permits)
  • NO HIGH-STIMULATION SCREENS (maintains sleep readiness)
  • Bubble Shield: Profile 2.0 as needed

8:30 PM - 9:30 PM | Bedtime Routine (1 hour)

  • Bath/Hygiene (30 min):
    • Baths, teeth brushing, pajamas
    • Calm, low-light environment
  • Bedtime Wind Down (30 min):
    • Reading in bed (individual or shared)
    • Low lights, calm voices
    • Establish sleep expectations
  • Lights Out (by 9:30 PM):
    • Age-appropriate bedtimes (adjust as needed)
    • White noise/calm music if helpful

9:30 PM - 10:00 PM | Personal Recovery (30 minutes)

  • Full Reset:
    • Quick house tidy
    • Personal hygiene
    • Decompress from day
  • Mental Transition: Prepare for next day

10:00 PM - 10:30 PM | Evening Protocols

  • FDP Active: Sleep Anchor Prep ‚Üí Daily Dump ‚Üí Sleep Anchor (30 minutes)
  • Status: Foundation running

SUNDAY SCHEDULE (GRANDMA'S HOUSE DAY)

CRITICAL NOTE: Sunday has the highest decision-making load and task management complexity of the entire weekend. Jacksonville family dinner requires extensive prep to prevent overwhelm for both you and the kids. This is the most structured day.

6:00 AM  ‚îÇ Personal Morning (FDP + Self-Regulation)
7:00 AM  ‚îÇ Morning Buffer (Children Wake Gradually)
9:00 AM  ‚îÇ **SUNDAY PREP PROTOCOL** ‚Üê MANDATORY (See below - 3 hours)
12:00 PM ‚îÇ Early Lunch & Final Departure Prep (30 min)
12:30 PM ‚îÇ Buffer Time (30 min - use for any missed prep)
1:00 PM  ‚îÇ Final Vehicle Check & Load (1 hr)
2:00 PM  ‚îÇ **DEPART FOR JACKSONVILLE** (Grandma's house)
2:00 PM  ‚îÇ Drive to Jacksonville (~1.5 hrs with kids)
3:30 PM  ‚îÇ Arrive at Grandma's, Family Dinner
7:30 PM  ‚îÇ Depart Jacksonville
8:00 PM  ‚îÇ **ARRIVE HOME** (kids already in PJs from Grandma's)
8:00 PM  ‚îÇ Rapid Bedtime Routine (30 min - teeth, bed, short story)
8:30 PM  ‚îÇ Lights Out (school night - earlier than normal)
9:00 PM  ‚îÇ Personal Recovery & Monday Prep Check (1 hr)
10:00 PM ‚îÇ Evening Protocols (FDP - Sleep Prep/Dump/Anchor)

üö® SUNDAY PREP PROTOCOL (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM) - MANDATORY

Why This Matters: Sunday involves 6 hours away from home (2 PM - 8 PM), a 3-hour round trip drive, family social obligations, and immediate Monday school/work transition. Without explicit prep, decision fatigue and task overwhelm cascade into Sunday night chaos and Monday morning disaster.

Philosophy: Reduce ALL decision-making and task execution to pre-defined checklists. No improvisation. No ‚Äúwe‚Äôll figure it out later.‚Äù Everything gets done Sunday morning or it doesn‚Äôt happen.

PHASE 1: Kids Prep (9:00 AM - 10:30 AM | 1.5 hours)

Location: Kids‚Äô rooms + common areas

Willow‚Äôs Prep (Age 6 - Dad assists heavily):

  • Make bed (pull covers, fluff pillow)
  • Pick Monday school outfit (lay on chair)
  • Pack school backpack with Dad‚Äôs help:
    • Homework folder (if any)
    • Water bottle (filled)
    • Lunch box (empty - Dad packs Monday AM)
    • Library books (if due)
    • Jacket/sweatshirt
  • Complete 3 daily chores (bedroom, dining room, living room)
  • Change into car clothes (comfy: leggings + cozy shirt)
  • Pack PJs in backpack (for changing at Grandma‚Äôs before drive home)
  • Pick one entertainment item for car (book or small toy - NO screens unless emergency)

Sebastian‚Äôs Prep (Age 9 - Mostly independent, Dad double-checks):

  • Make bed (full bed making: sheets, blankets, pillows)
  • Pick Monday school outfit (lay out complete)
  • Pack school backpack (self-check, Dad verifies):
    • All homework completed and packed
    • iPad/tablet charged (if school device)
    • Water bottle (filled)
    • Lunch box (empty - Dad packs Monday AM)
    • Permission slips/school papers signed
    • PE clothes (if PE day)
    • Jacket/sweatshirt
  • Complete 3 daily chores (bedroom, bathroom, living room)
  • Help Dad with house prep (trash out, pet check)
  • Change into car clothes (sweats + hoodie)
  • Pack PJs in backpack (for Grandma‚Äôs)
  • Pick car entertainment (book, sketchpad, handheld game - screens OK for Sebastian)

Dad‚Äôs Role During Phase 1:

  • Supervise Willow closely (she needs more help)
  • Spot-check Sebastian (he‚Äôs more independent)
  • Answer questions without making new decisions (‚Äústick to the list‚Äù)
  • Keep kids on task without creating stress

PHASE 2: House Prep (10:30 AM - 11:15 AM | 45 minutes)

Location: Whole house

  • Kids‚Äô backpacks loaded in car trunk (done and forgotten)
  • Pets sorted:
    • Food bowls filled (enough for 6 hours)
    • Water bowls filled
    • Litter box clean (if applicable)
    • Pets have safe space while house empty
  • House security:
    • All windows closed
    • Doors locked (check front, back, garage)
    • Valuables secured
    • Lights on timers (if applicable)
  • Monday Prep (reduces Monday AM chaos):
    • Lay out Monday work clothes (full outfit: underwear to shoes)
    • Prep Monday lunch components (washed fruit, prepped veggies, ready to assemble)
    • Coffee maker prepped (ready to brew - just hit button)
    • Work bag packed (laptop, charger, keys, wallet, phone)

PHASE 3: Personal & Vehicle Prep (11:15 AM - 12:00 PM | 45 minutes)

Location: Bathroom, bedroom, garage

Personal Prep:

  • Shower (if needed - you‚Äôll be with family for 5+ hours)
  • Change into ‚ÄúGrandma-appropriate‚Äù clothes (clean, casual, comfortable for driving)
  • Medication check (did you take Sunday AM pills?)
  • Hydration (drink full water bottle - you‚Äôre about to drive)
  • Mental prep: ‚ÄúSocial mode active. High vigilance. Short duration. You can do this.‚Äù

Vehicle Prep:

  • Gas check (at least 1/2 tank - no stopping with kids in car)
  • Kids‚Äô car entertainment loaded:
    • Willow‚Äôs book/toy accessible
    • Sebastian‚Äôs entertainment accessible
    • Backup snacks in car (goldfish, granola bars - non-messy)
    • Water bottles in cup holders
    • Charging cables for devices (if needed)
  • Adult vehicle needs:
    • Bubble Shield charged and in car (Soundcore Space One - for sensory regulation if needed)
    • Sunglasses accessible
    • Phone charged + car charger ready
    • GPS/directions to Grandma‚Äôs loaded (even if you know the way - reduces cognitive load)
  • Gift/contribution for Grandma (if bringing food, gifts, etc.):
    • Loaded in car
    • Not forgotten in fridge/counter

Final Check (11:55 AM):

  • Kids in car clothes? ‚úì
  • Kids‚Äô backpacks in trunk? ‚úì
  • PJs packed for kids? ‚úì
  • House locked? ‚úì
  • Pets sorted? ‚úì
  • Gas sufficient? ‚úì
  • Car entertainment ready? ‚úì
  • Monday prep complete? ‚úì

PHASE 4: Early Lunch & Buffer (12:00 PM - 1:00 PM | 1 hour)

  • 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM: Quick lunch at home
    • Simple, no-cook meal (sandwiches, leftovers, cereal)
    • Hydration check for everyone
    • Bathroom break for kids (mandatory - no stops on road)
  • 12:30 PM - 1:00 PM: Buffer time
    • Use for any missed prep tasks
    • Calm down period (no new activities)
    • Final mental prep: ‚ÄúEverything is ready. We just drive now.‚Äù

PHASE 5: Final Load & Departure (1:00 PM - 2:00 PM | 1 hour)

  • 1:00 PM - 1:45 PM: Final vehicle check
    • Kids use bathroom (last chance)
    • Load any last-minute items
    • Kids get in car seats/belts
    • Final house walkthrough (did we forget anything?)
  • 1:45 PM - 2:00 PM: Departure buffer
    • If ready early, leave early (less stress)
    • If on time, leave at 2:00 PM sharp
    • NO LATE DEPARTURES (creates rushed driving, stressed arrival)

üè† AT GRANDMA‚ÄôS HOUSE (3:30 PM - 7:30 PM | 4 hours)

Your Role: High vigilance, low stimulation (for yourself)

Kids‚Äô Expectations (covered in their SOP, but you enforce):

  • Use inside voices
  • Ask before taking food/drinks
  • Stay in visible areas
  • Use manners (please/thank you)
  • Tell you if bathroom needed or feeling sick

Your Strategy:

  • Bubble Shield available (Profile 2.0 in pocket if social overwhelm hits)
  • Low conversation energy (you don‚Äôt have to be ‚Äúon‚Äù - presence is enough)
  • Monitor kids without micromanaging (they know the rules)
  • Eat, hydrate, use bathroom (take care of your needs)
  • Around 7:00 PM: Initiate kids‚Äô PJ change (before drive home)
    • ‚ÄúSebastian, Willow - go change into PJs now. We‚Äôre leaving in 30 minutes.‚Äù
    • Reduces home arrival chaos (they‚Äôll be ready for bed)

üöó DRIVE HOME (7:30 PM - 8:00 PM | 30 minutes)

Kids: Already in PJs, may fall asleep in car (ideal)

You: Focus on driving, minimize conversation

Arrive Home 8:00 PM:

  • Kids already in PJs ‚úì
  • Backpacks already in trunk for Monday ‚úì
  • Monday clothes already laid out ‚úì
  • Monday lunch prep already done ‚úì

This is why Sunday Prep matters.

üåô RAPID BEDTIME ROUTINE (8:00 PM - 8:30 PM | 30 minutes)

Simplified Sunday Night (school tomorrow, everyone‚Äôs tired):

  • 8:00 PM: Arrive home, unload kids
  • 8:05 PM: Teeth brushing (quick - 2 minutes)
  • 8:10 PM: Straight to beds
  • 8:15 PM: Short story time or calm talking (no long books)
  • 8:30 PM: Lights out (earlier than usual - school tomorrow)

No bath needed (they showered Saturday night, going straight to school Monday AM)

üò§ PERSONAL RECOVERY (8:30 PM - 10:00 PM | 1.5 hours)

You just completed:

  • 3 hours of intensive Sunday prep coordination
  • 6 hours away from home with kids
  • 3 hours total driving
  • 4 hours of social/family obligations

Recovery Protocol:

  • 8:30 PM - 9:00 PM: House reset (30 min)
    • Unload car (backpacks stay in trunk for Monday - DON‚ÄôT bring inside)
    • Quick kitchen tidy (no deep clean)
    • Pets check-in
    • Decompress (sit down, breathe)
  • 9:00 PM - 9:30 PM: Monday AM final check (30 min)
    • Verify Monday outfit laid out ‚úì
    • Verify lunch prep done ‚úì
    • Verify coffee ready ‚úì
    • Verify kids‚Äô backpacks in car ‚úì
    • Set alarm for Monday 6 AM
  • 9:30 PM - 10:00 PM: Personal wind down (30 min)
    • Shower (if needed)
    • Hydration
    • Sensory regulation (Bubble Shield cooldown, calm environment)

10:00 PM - 10:30 PM | Evening Protocols

  • FDP Active: Sleep Anchor Prep ‚Üí Daily Dump ‚Üí Sleep Anchor (30 minutes)
  • Status: Foundation running
  • Note: You did Sunday. Monday will be easier because of today‚Äôs prep.

MONDAY MORNING DEPARTURE

6:00 AM - 7:00 AM | Personal Morning

  • FDP Active: Water Protocol ‚Üí Pill Protocol
  • Personal Prep (57 min): Standard morning routine

7:00 AM - 9:00 AM | Children Morning Routine

  • Wake, Breakfast, Prepare for Departure:
    • Assist with morning routine
    • Pack bags, verify belongings
    • Light breakfast
    • Calm, structured morning

9:00 AM - 10:00 AM | Departure Prep

  • Final Checks:
    • Bags packed
    • Personal items accounted for
    • Thank-yous, goodbyes

10:00 AM | Departure

  • Children Leave

10:00 AM - 6:00 PM | Recovery & Transition

  • Protocol: Full Environment Reset
  • Action (6 hours available):
    1. Immediate Decompress (1 hr):
      • Quiet space, low stimulation
      • Hydration, light snack
      • Processing time
    2. Full House Reset (2 hrs):
      • Deep clean common areas
      • Remove child-specific items to storage
      • Reset Command Center for Solo Mode
      • Meal prep verification (for upcoming week)
    3. Mental Transition (1 hr):
      • Journal about weekend (capture thoughts)
      • Review upcoming week in Google Tasks
      • Load tomorrow‚Äôs 3 critical tasks
    4. Physical Regulation (1 hr):
      • Movement protocol (walk, workout, garden)
      • Dopamine reset after high-vigilance weekend
    5. Buffer (1 hr):
      • Personal time, rest
      • Light hobby work
      • Entertainment

6:00 PM | MODE SWITCH

  • Solo Execution Mode ACTIVE
  • Personal time structure resumes

FIXED MEAL SCHEDULE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

FRIDAY
Dinner: Pizza (Easy first-night meal)

SATURDAY
Breakfast: Pancakes/Eggs
Lunch: Sandwiches
Dinner: Tacos (Interactive, predictable)

SUNDAY
Breakfast: Oatmeal/Fruit
Lunch: Leftovers/Simple
Dinner: Roast (Comfort food, low-effort)

MONDAY
Breakfast: Cereal/Quick Options

Purpose: Eliminates decision fatigue, provides predictability for neurodivergent regulation.

EXECUTION CHECKLIST (DAILY)

Morning

  • 6:00 AM: FDP (Water, Pills)
  • 7:00-9:00 AM: Children wake, breakfast, routine
  • Bubble Shield Profile 2.0 during transitions

Core Blocks

  • 10:00 AM-12:00 PM: Structured Activity (Outdoor/Physical)
  • 12:00-1:00 PM: Lunch & Transition
  • 1:00-3:00 PM: QUIET TIME PROTOCOL (Mandatory regulation)
  • 3:00-5:00 PM: Structured Interest Block (Shared project)

Evening

  • 5:00-6:00 PM: Dinner Prep
  • 6:00-7:00 PM: Dinner & Cleanup
  • 7:00-8:30 PM: Evening Free Time (Low-stimulation)
  • 8:30-9:30 PM: Bedtime Routine
  • 9:30-10:00 PM: Personal Recovery
  • 10:00-10:30 PM: FDP (Sleep Prep, Daily Dump, Sleep)

TOOLS REQUIRED

  • Soundcore Space One Headphones (Bubble Shield Profile 2.0: Transparency 5, Vol 10%)
  • Large Whiteboard (Visual schedule for children)
  • Google Tasks (Weekend structure planning)
  • Fixed Meal Schedule (Eliminates decision fatigue)
  • Shared Activity Supplies (Woodworking, 3D printing, LEGOs, etc.)

Status: ACTIVE - Fri 4 PM ‚Üí Mon 6 PM
